Description: Squat jar of marl clay pottery with rounded body, two pierced tubular-handles and flat ledge rim (chipped); decorated in red-brown paint with one large spiral on each side of the body, with wavy lines above and over the handles, one wavy line on rim top and across the bottom.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Gaston C C Maspero
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D34D in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair (repaired); two pieces re-joined, adhesive (wax?) adhering exuding from breaks.
